title: Acis and Galatea (Handel)
extract: Acis and Galatea is a musical work by George Frideric Handel with an English text by John Gay. The work has been variously described as a serenata, a masque, a pastoral or pastoral opera, a "little opera", an entertainment and by the New Grove Dictionary of Music as an oratorio. The work was originally devised as a one-act masque which premiered in 1718.
extract_html: Acis and Galatea is a musical work by George Frideric Handel with an English text by John Gay. The work was originally devised as a one-act masque which premiered in 1718.
